questions.question: What are your operating hours?
questions.answer: We are open 24/7, including all holidays. Our emergency services are available round the clock to ensure your pet gets immediate care whenever needed.

questions.question: Do I need an appointment?
questions.answer: While we do accept walk-ins, we highly recommend scheduling an appointment to minimize wait times. For emergencies, no appointment is necessary - just come straight in or call us.

questions.question: What types of pets do you treat?
questions.answer: We treat dogs, cats, birds, rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters, reptiles, and other exotic pets. Our team includes specialists for various types of animals.

questions.question: Do you offer home visit services?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer home visits for elderly pets, pets with mobility issues, or for post-operative checkups. Please contact us to schedule a home visit.

questions.question: How do I book an appointment?
questions.answer: You can book an appointment by calling us at +91 90879 90819, through our website's booking form, or via WhatsApp. We'll confirm your appointment within a few hours.

questions.question: What should I bring to my pet's first visit?
questions.answer: Please bring any previous medical records, vaccination certificates, current medications, and a list of any concerns or questions you have about your pet's health.

questions.question: Can I stay with my pet during examination?
questions.answer: Yes! We encourage owners to be present during examinations and consultations. However, for certain procedures or if your pet is calmer without you, we may ask you to wait in the reception area.

questions.question: How long does a typical consultation take?
questions.answer: A standard consultation usually takes 20-30 minutes. However, complex cases or first visits may require more time. We never rush appointments to ensure thorough care.

questions.question: Do you provide vaccination services?
questions.answer: Yes, we provide all core and non-core vaccinations for dogs, cats, and other pets. We follow internationally recommended vaccination schedules and can customize them based on your pet's lifestyle.

questions.question: What emergency services do you offer?
questions.answer: Our 24/7 emergency services include trauma care, poisoning treatment, difficulty breathing, seizures, severe bleeding, bloat, and any life-threatening condition. We have ICU facilities and emergency surgery capabilities.

questions.question: Do you perform spay/neuter surgeries?
questions.answer: Yes, we perform spay and neuter surgeries for dogs, cats, and rabbits. These procedures are done under general anesthesia with comprehensive pain management and post-operative care.

questions.question: Can you help with behavioral issues?
questions.answer: While we're not certified animal behaviorists, our veterinarians can address medical causes of behavioral problems and provide basic training advice. We can also refer you to certified behaviorists if needed.

questions.question: What payment methods do you accept?
questions.answer: We accept cash, credit/debit cards, UPI, net banking, and digital wallets. Payment is due at the time of service unless prior arrangements have been made.

questions.question: Do you accept pet insurance?
questions.answer: Yes, we work with most major pet insurance providers. Please bring your insurance information to your appointment. We can provide all necessary documentation for your claim.

questions.question: Do you offer payment plans?
questions.answer: For expensive treatments or surgeries, we can discuss payment plan options on a case-by-case basis. Please speak with our reception staff about your situation.

questions.question: Can I get a cost estimate before treatment?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We always provide detailed cost estimates before performing any procedure or treatment. We believe in transparency and will explain all charges clearly.

questions.question: What constitutes a pet emergency?
questions.answer: Emergencies include difficulty breathing, severe bleeding, seizures, loss of consciousness, suspected poisoning, bloat, inability to urinate, severe pain, trauma, heatstroke, or any situation where your pet's life may be in danger.

questions.question: Should I call before bringing my pet in an emergency?
questions.answer: If possible, please call us while you're on your way so we can prepare for your arrival. However, if it's a critical emergency, don't delay - come directly to the clinic.

questions.question: Do you have an ambulance service?
questions.answer: Yes, we have a 24/7 ambulance service for emergencies. Call us immediately and we'll dispatch our ambulance to pick up your pet if they cannot be transported safely.

questions.question: What happens during an emergency visit?
questions.answer: Our emergency team will immediately assess your pet's condition, stabilize them if necessary, and provide life-saving treatment. We'll keep you informed throughout the process and discuss treatment options.

questions.question: What are your boarding requirements?
questions.answer: All pets must be up-to-date on vaccinations and flea/tick prevention. We require vaccination records and a brief health history. Pets with aggressive behavior may not be suitable for boarding.

questions.question: Can I visit my pet during boarding?
questions.answer: Yes, you can visit during our visiting hours (10 AM - 6 PM). We also provide daily photo updates via WhatsApp so you can see how your pet is doing.

questions.question: What grooming services do you offer?
questions.answer: We offer bathing, hair trimming/styling, nail clipping, ear cleaning, teeth brushing, and de-shedding treatments. All grooming is done by trained professionals who prioritize your pet's comfort.

questions.question: Do you groom anxious or aggressive pets?
questions.answer: Yes, we have experience handling anxious and difficult pets. In some cases, mild sedation may be recommended for the safety and comfort of your pet during grooming.
